programme.title: Hatton Garden: The Inside Story
programme.desc: Ross Kemp examines the April 2015 heist in London's diamond district, when a group of career criminals broke into a safe deposit facility and stole approximately £14million in precious metals, cash and jewels, an event dubbed the biggest burglary of its type in British history. The documentary gains access to the secret surveillance material that put the thieves behind bars and features exclusive interviews with the detectives who cracked the case as well as Kenny Collins, one of the thieves involved

programme.title: Ice Cold Killers
programme.desc: The case of renowned Alaskan gold miner and outspoken political activist Joe Vogler, who vanished from his remote Fairbanks home in 1993. Police found his residence undisturbed with no evidence of foul play, but his allies refused to give up their search, forcing authorities to consider such theories as murder, a government conspiracy or even alien abduction

programme.title: Doctor Finlay

Meanwhile, Janet grapples with her own problems and Dr Cameron's night-time call-out is tinged with tragedy. Medical drama, starring David Rintoul

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: The medic resolves to track down a mysterious man who callously ignored his request to call for an ambulance - and Finlay's obsession soon leads him into a macabre world. Drama, starring David Rintoul

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Cameron feels increasingly isolated as the day of Janet and Angus's wedding approaches and Dr Finlay is drawn toward the new National Health Service. Rural medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: When a German mayor visits Great Slaughter to partake in a war memorial ceremony, tragedy strikes; Sister Boniface investigates whether it's a accident or a malicious plan

programme.title: Sister Boniface Mysteries
programme.desc: The preliminary rounds of Miss United Britain are well underway, but the beauty queens get a gruesome wakeup call when Miss Northern Ireland is found drowned

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: A wealthy Irishwoman descends on the restaurant with her new husband in tow who turns out to be a figure from Margaret's wild past in swinging 1960s London. Crime drama, starring Richard Griffiths, Maggie Steed and Nigel Terry

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe comes to the rescue when a regular customer is hounded by the police, but the sleuthing chef finds himself caught up in a long-running feud between notorious villain Razor Reg Costigan and his arch-rival Striker of the Yard. Offbeat drama, guest starring Nicholas Ball

programme.title: Pie in the Sky
programme.desc: Crabbe investigates a spate of garden thefts, focusing his inquiries on a horticultural landscaper whose business has blossomed since the robberies began. Unfortunately, his initial stake-out proves a disaster and, to top it all, Margaret hires the chief suspect to redesign the plot behind the restaurant. Drama, starring Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: In the summer of 1966, the Northumbrian police come under increasing media scrutiny as Sunderland prepares to host a World Cup match involving the USSR, while campaigners protest against the proposed landing of the Polaris nuclear submarine at Jarrow docks. When an academic is found dead after a CND rally, Gently and Bacchus are dispatched to Durham University to investigate his background - and find themselves in the middle of a wave of social and sexual rebellion. Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with Sarah Lancashire and Warren Clarke

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: Chaos ensues when a museum's Egyptian mummy case turns out to contain the body of a very recently deceased woman

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The sleuthing priest sets out to solve the murder of a local aeronautics magnate's son, and disaster strikes when Lady Felicia loses her singing voice. Robert Daws guest stars

programme.title: Mrs Wilson
programme.desc: After the sudden death of novelist and Secret Intelligence Service worker Alexander Wilson, wife Alison is forced to investigate when mysteries from her late husband's past come knocking. Drama, starring Ruth Wilson, Iain Glen and Keeley Hawes

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: In the summer of 1966, the Northumbrian police come under increasing media scrutiny as Sunderland prepares to host a World Cup match involving the USSR, while campaigners protest against the proposed landing of the Polaris nuclear submarine at Jarrow docks. programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A war begins between rival taxi firms, confronting the team with a series of coincidences to investigate, and Taggart's family problems are compounded when his daughter is implicated in a murder investigation. Glasgow-set detective drama, with Mark McManus, James MacPherson and Blythe Duff. Directed by series regular Alan Macmillan, who also worked on The Bill and Ballykissangel. The supporting cast includes Iain Anders, Robert Robertson, Stewart Preston, Harriet Buchan, Leigh Biagi, Andy McEwan and Peter O'Brien

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Pru from the Embassy visits Barry in jail and reassures the gang they are doing everything they can to free him - but the Cubans have discovered his Russian connections and convinced themselves he is a spy. Neville feels the pressure as he is forced to home in on his target, and Oz faces a major setback in his relationship with Ofelia. Timothy Spall, Jimmy Nail, Tim Healy and Kevin Whately star

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry Young is taken hostage while investigating a routine report of a house break-in, and Nick Klein tells Phil Hunter he may have jeopardised the drugs operation by letting it slip in an unguarded moment that he is a police officer. Behind the scenes, Mickey Webb stirs up a hornets' nest by telling Peter Marsden how Superintendent Tom Chandler raped his sister, setting the scene for a volatile confrontation at Sun Hill. Beth Cordingly and Rene Zagger star

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: When another body turns up on the banks of the Thames, Klein fears his club 'colleague' Sandie could be the Sun Hill serial killer's latest victim, and Chandler walks into a tight corner when he visits Anne Merrick to prove his innocence. Back at the station Cryer says too much to headline-hungry hack Simon Kitson, unwittingly setting Stamp on course for a lot of grief, and Hunter's intelligence on the Dutch drugs shipment seems too good to be true

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Merrick's shock revelation that Chandler raped her prompts a full-scale investigation at Sun Hill. While Meadows relishes the opportunity of subjecting the superintendent to a battery of uncomfortable forensic tests, Gold and Sharpe question Merrick and begin to wonder whether she's telling the whole truth. Meanwhile, an angry mob surround PC Stamp's house, leaving the understandably furious constable determined to find out who has been spreading rumours that he's a paedophile

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Chandler realises his career is on the line as Chief Superintendent Henry prepares to interrogate him over the rape of Anne Merrick and is forced to beg McAllister to provide an alibi. The atmosphere at the station is fraught as Ackland and Carver panic about having their secret affair discovered by Stamp, the Ashton-Young-Gilmore triangle gets messy, and a teenage mother arrives at Sun Hill demanding to see PC Best. Drama, starring Steven Hartley and Natalie Roles

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Cynthia's district nursing rounds find her tending a diabetic man who turns out to be a terrible bully to his wife, while Jenny looks after a black mother-to-be being subjected to racial prejudice from her neighbours. Nonnatus House prepares for the return of Chummy from Sierra Leone - but she has her own surprise. Miranda Hart, Jessica Raine and Bryony Hannah star

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: There's a buzz of excitement at Nonnatus House as Chummy and Peter prepare for the arrival of their baby, Fred has a visit from his pregnant daughter and Jenny's love life is looking up when she is introduced to a potential new gentleman friend. However, change is in the air in Poplar and soon the friends are forced to stand together as their home comes under threat. Jessica Raine, Miranda Hart, Cliff Parisi, Ben Caplan and Pam Ferris star

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Round Tower
programme.desc: Feature-length drama set in the 1950s, starring Emilia Fox as the rebellious teenage daughter of a successful businessman and his devoted wife, whose disenchantment with her privileged upbringing ultimately provokes a scandal in their small town. Keith Barron and Jan Harvey also star

programme.title: Miss Marple: 4.50 from Paddington
programme.desc: Miss Marple's bloodhound instincts are triggered when a friend thinks she sees a murder on a train. When police cannot find a body and cast doubt on the story, Miss Marple decides to investigate. She thinks the body could be found on the banks belonging to Crackenthorpe house, a stately mansion and enlists professional housekeeper Lucy Eyelesbarrow to go undercover. The body of the woman is eventually discovered in a barn. Mystery, starring Joan Hickson

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries
programme.desc: Cabinet minister Derek O'Callaghan begins receiving death threats and later dies in suspicious circumstances while being operated on at a nursing home, raising fears that he has been murdered. Feature-length crime drama, starring Patrick Malahide and William Simons

programme.title: McMafia
programme.desc: Benny uncovers information about a shipment of heroin being smuggled from Pakistan into India. He does not realise that Dilly is spying on him, and after a robbery, gains all the information he needs to pull off a heist - however Semiyon warns that it is Alex's decision whether the operation goes ahead. Karin is suspicious about the fund Alex is using to move Semiyon's money around, while Rebecca becomes concerned when she discovers Alex has a secret second phone. In Prague, Vadim resolves to find out who Benes is in league with

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: The detective must confront a demon from his past, as both the police and Cornelius converge on his home. With Halliday convinced that the body in the morgue isn't their killer, can Luther put his own troubles to one side and find the true murderer before he strikes again? Thriller, starring Idris Elba, Ruth Wilson and Dermot Crowley

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A horse trainer with money worries is found hanged, and suicide is suspected until tests reveal he was drugged shortly before his death. Lynley discovers the cove on the victim's estate was used to land contraband, and connects the death to a smuggling racket, but Havers suspects the answer lies with the local riding community. Detective drama, starring Nathaniel Parker and Sharon Small

programme.title: Leonardo
programme.desc: Ludovico asks Leonardo to create a sculpture in honour of his father. As he gets distracted from Caterina, Leonardo ends up in a race against time with a costly decision to make

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon spreads her wings and takes full advantage of her sister's hospitality, but Tracey is having money worries. Ross Kemp guest stars, with Linda Robson and Pauline Quirke

Cameron feels the pressure when tasked with treating Xavier's close relative, while an indifferent Dom tries to keep Carole at arm's length

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: A decomposing body in a flat leaves Stamp and Best with a baffling challenge to trace the dead man's wife - if she ever existed. Arsenal are battling City for the title, and will have expected a second win of the season against the Cherries. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Palmer, who went to Tenerife on holiday with his family just before his attempted arrest, learns the police want to speak to him and publicly states his innocence in a television interview. Cooper and Parry successfully move the remaining criminal proceeds from Switzerland to Liechtenstein, but their courier gets caught at the border with the cash. Noye's murder trial comes to a dramatic conclusion

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Manchester United at Anfield and Nottingham Forest v Everton at the City Ground. United were looking to do the double over their fierce rivals for the first time since 2015/16 season after prevailing 2-1 when the sides met at Old Trafford in August. Forest and Everton shared the spoils in a 1-1 draw at Goodison Park, but both teams will have been looking for all three points on this occasion to help ease any relegation concerns. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Chelsea v Arsenal in the League Cup final, and Manchester United v Leicester City and Manchester City v Tottenham Hotspur in the WSL

programme.title: Fast Girls (2012)
programme.desc: A fierce rivalry develops between a talented working-class sprinter and the wealthy daughter of a former Olympic medal-winner as they compete on the track. They are forced to settle their differences and work together when they are recruited for the same relay team. Drama, with Lily James, Lenora Crichlow, Rupert Graves and Noel Clarke, who also co-wrote the script

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Gethin Jones and Kym Marsh host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley showcase the work of frontline forces as well as asking for help on unsolved cases

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In Kent, a police sergeant puts his life in danger when he rescues a man from a house fire, while in Bristol two cops wrestle an armed robber to the ground. In Oxfordshire, after being assaulted by a man he's trying to help, a paramedic has an arranged meeting with the offender

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell examine properties in Surrey, Merseyside and London just prior to them being sold. After they are auctioned, the presenters hear of the new owners' plans for their acquisitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Oswestry in Shropshire, and visits a museum of model cars. Experts Charles Hanson and Ben Cooper assist the teams in finding a bargain

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob and Karen plan to surprise everyone and Kirsty and Rich are concerned about Ollie's future. Zara's patient is determined to find her missing parent

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay shares creative and money-saving tips and tricks for the home and garden, including how to build a floating desk and upholster an old stool. Plus, Sarah Moore demonstrates a way to recycle old jars, and Monty Don shares a fantastic method of making a raised bed for the garden

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a buyer from suburban Surrey, who is looking for a new family home with enough land to start a dog training school in south-west Wales. As an alternative to machinery and man hours, Jules also meets a flock of goats for hire capable of clearing an overgrown patch of land in no time at all

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer sets off on a road trip with new rival jewellery expert Ishy Khan. They kick off in Kendal, with £200 each, looking for antiques that will make them the most profit

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: An intrepid team of four friends competes for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas bring you the stories that matter from across the country

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zack and Whitney say goodbye to their daughter and Sonia enlists the Walford residents to create a condolence box for them. Stacey worries about Lily when she needs a new uniform, but feels more grateful than ever for her family

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Marianna Spring reports on how Elon Musk's ownership of Twitter is transforming one the world's most influential social media platforms. Current and former insiders in San Francisco and the UK reveal how hate and misogyny are thriving under the new owner, following the dismissal of thousands of staff and the reinstatement of users previously banned for breaking Twitter's rules

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Fatemah has still never taken a driving test despite learning to drive for eight years. It has fallen to the 25-year-old's adoring but nerve-shattered dad Akil to instruct her. But as Scarlett Moffatt's experts discover, the driving may not be the problem

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Lou makes one last desperate attempt to bring Col down by trying to convince him that the police are coming to raid his house, and that his only hope is to hand over any incriminating evidence to her. However, her plan does not go exactly as she hoped. Feeling powerless, Ceri resorts to drastic action in order to defend his family

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: That Great British Documentary
programme.desc: Shot over 10 years and prompted by the death of her father, film-maker JoanJoan explores Britain's colonial past and the legacy her dual black and white heritage has had on her life

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: With elimination looming, the power given to one trainee rocks the group, putting them all at risk of being sent home from the island

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The first of two compilations of highlights from the recent series. Among the guests featured are Taylor Swift, Daniel Craig, Eddie Redmayne, Lashana Lynch, Bono, Kate Hudson, Ian McKellen, Paul Mescal, Geena Davis, Stormzy, Lesley Manville, Colin Farrell and Bruce Springsteen

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the morning session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The men's heptathlon continues with the 60m, long jump and shot put, and the men's 60m heats also take place

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall's global journey culminates in a visit to Antarctica, the land of extremes. The presenter tackles freezing conditions to explore the underwater world of an iceberg, has an encounter with a group of humpback whales, and fulfils a lifelong ambition by diving with one of the greatest predators to inhabit the waters - the leopard seal

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: As the drought ends and the land returns to its former beauty, newborn giraffe Twiga takes his tentative first steps, trying to control his gangly legs - and he must learn quickly as lioness Kali is on the prowl. Another baby enters the elephant herd, and shortly after the newborn's father appears to greet his son in an awe-inspiring moment. Mafuta and the rest of the hippos return to the river, only to find the crocodiles have laid claim to the riverbank - so the hippos try to evict their old enemies

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: The Wyoming Wetlands Society is a non-profit organisation that relocates beavers that have been damaging expensive landscaped areas and flooding yards and roads with their dam-building activities in Teton County. This documentary follows the work of Drew Reed as he traps the problem animals and takes them to drainage areas of the Gros Ventre River, where the beavers help to restore and enhance wetland habitats, providing many direct and indirect benefits to both wildlife and people. Rob Brydon narrates

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets his good friend, the actor and comedian Barry Humphries, who fell in love with Cornwall in the 1960s when he escaped London to develop his famous character Dame Edna Everage. Barry talks about his friendship with British poet John Betjeman, and asks Rick to review his home-made fishcakes. Rick also goes fishing for crab, before cooking a simple yet delicious crab omelette. The host then takes a dip in the chilly north Atlantic with an eccentric group of wild water swimmers called the Perranporth Blue Tits

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman hosts a star-studded version of the culinary contest, which sees Mary Berry, Chris Bavin and Angela Hartnett judging 10 famous cooks. Taking part are Ferne McCann, Gareth Thomas, Desiree Burch, Ed Balls, Karim Zeroual, Ruth Madeley, Tom Read Wilson, Shobna Gulati, Ed Byrne and Rachel Johnson. In this first edition, Mary wants to know what home cooking means to the contestants, so she challenges them to produce their ultimate home-cooked dinner

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Sylvia Syms revisits some of the great British war films that helped boost the nation's morale in the difficult years that followed the end of the Second World War. Among the silver screen gems highlighted are In Which We Serve, Reach for the Sky, Bridge on the River Kwai and The Dam Busters. The programme includes archive interviews with stars including Noel Coward, Richard Attenborough, David Lean, Alec Guinness, Kenneth More and John Mills, and Sylvia shares her memories of filming her own contribution to the genre, Ice Cold in Alex

programme.title: The Eagle Has Landed (1976)
programme.desc: A Nazi secret agent plans to kidnap Winston Churchill while the prime minister spends a weekend in the Norfolk countryside, and plants covert operatives in the area ready for his arrival. Second World War adventure, adapted from Jack Higgins' novel, starring Michael Caine, Donald Sutherland, Robert Duvall, Jenny Agutter, Donald Pleasence, Anthony Quayle and Jean Marsh

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further live coverage of the second session on day three from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. Medals are decided in the women's triple jump, 1500m and 400m and the men's 400m and 600m. Reigning Olympic 100m champion Marcell Jacobs of Italy claimed an emphatic victory over 60m when the event was last held two years ago in Poland. With analysis by Jessica Ennis-Hill and Denise Lewis, and commentary from Steve Cram and Andrew Cotter

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Comedian Lucy Porter and Chaser Jenny Ryan visit antique shops in south Wales. On hand to help are experts Serhat Ahmet and Steven Moore. An alcohol-themed spending spree sees both celebrity trippers purchasing items once used for marketing boozy products. However, they buy classy objects too, including something originating from Buckingham Palace and some quite pricy oak library steps

programme.title: Universe
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox explores the Milky Way, using data from a cutting-edge space telescope to reveal the dramatic history of Earth's galaxy, and predict its cataclysmic future. The European Space Agency's Gaia Space Telescope painstakingly measures the true position of over a billion stars, producing the most accurate map of the Milky Way ever created, while also measuring their movement, allowing their positions to be tracked back through time

programme.title: Dionne Warwick - Don't Make Me Over
programme.desc: Profile of the singer whose career has spanned more than four decades with hits such as Alfie, Walk On By and That's What Friends Are For. Featuring contributions from friends, family and collaborators including Burt Bacharach, Tom Jones, Gloria Estefan, Quincy Jones and Michael Caine

programme.title: Dionne Warwick at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of performances on BBC programmes by the singer, featuring Heartbreaker, Always Something There to Remind Me, Anyone Who Had a Heart, All the Love in the World, and That's What Friends Are For with Elton John

programme.title: Fern Britton Meets
programme.desc: The singer looks back on her 50-year career, which began with the release in 1962 of her first single Don't Make Me Over and has most recently seen her re-record some of her best-known hits. The entertainer also discusses the death of her cousin Whitney Houston earlier this year, fighting racism, and the importance of her Christian faith

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The Baron awakens from his deathly slumber, and demands the other vampires show him the wonders of life in the New World - so the housemates treat him to a night out in Manhattan. Supernatural sitcom, starring Kayvan Novak, Matt Berry and Natasia Demetriou

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: The housemates awaken to an unexpected crisis with no memory of how it happened, and find themselves put on trial by an international tribunal of vampires. Tilda Swinton heads up a star-studded guest cast, including Dave Bautista (Guardians of the Galaxy), Kristen Schaal (Flight of the Conchords), Danny Trejo (Machete), Wesley Snipes (Blade), Evan Rachel Wood (True Blood), and the stars of the original movie, Taika Waititi, Jemaine Clement and Jonny Brugh, reprising their roles

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: Nadja gives Jenna an introduction to life as a vampire and trains her how to take her first victim, while Nandor applies for American citizenship

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: Tensions run high as the housemates prepare to host the Biannual Vampire Orgy - and Guillermo fears that an old friend of his will end up being killed during the party. Comedy, starring Matt Berry, Kayvan Novak, and Natasia Demetriou

programme.title: What We Do in the Shadows
programme.desc: Nandor pays a visit to one of his living descendants, while Nadja is reunited with her continually reincarnated lover Gregor, still in the guise of nightwatchman Jeff. Comedy, starring Matt Berry, Kayvan Novak, and Natasia Demetriou

programme.title: Tove (2020)
programme.desc: Biopic of writer and artist Tove Jansson, following her newfound creative and personal freedom in the wake of the Second World War. As the Moomin stories evolve from the tales she used to tell children in the bomb shelters, she is torn between her love for a theatre director and her open relationship with a married politician. Starring Alma Poysti and Krista Kosonen. In Swedish, Finnish, English and French

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Sunday Morning Stories
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley shares her favourite tales of faith, hope and spirituality, when ordinary people do extraordinary things

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Live coverage of the morning session on day four from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey. The first medals of the day are decided in the men's long jump and women's high jump, while the heptathlon continues and the men's and women's 60m hurdles semi-finals also take place

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before - loofahs. Joe Swift visits a garden where the contemporary and traditional meet. And Advolly Richmond discovers a stunning Japanese-inspired garden

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits a deer farm near Bodmin Moor run by Pip and Matt Smith, before returning to the kitchen in Padstow to make a simple venison Wellington. Later, he spends an afternoon on Porthgwarra beach with the artist Hannah Woodman, whose work is inspired by the sea-worn landscape of West Cornwall, before defining the Cornish sense of humour over a pint with comedian Jonny Cowling

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Short
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Simon King look at baking bread, making a classic brown loaf to go with a ploughman's lunch, and brown ale and cheese bread, served with onion soup

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Manchester United v Leicester City (Kick-off 12.30pm). All the action from the top-flight clash at Leigh Sports Village. United have been in fine form this season and are aiming to win this title for the first time in their history, while the Foxes are in need of a shock result as they are struggling against relegation

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Colin Stafford-Johnson travels to the Indonesian island of Sulawesi to examine the lives of Celebes crested macaques, which are found nowhere else in the world. He teams up with a local biologist to get to know some of the characters in the troop and reveal their habits, and learns that the species has become endangered due to an illegal trade in its meat, which is seen as a delicacy

programme.title: Live Athletics
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents live coverage of the second session on day four from Atakoy Arena in Istanbul, Turkey, as the event concludes. Medals are decided in the men's high jump, 4x400m relay, pole vault, heptathlon, 800m and 60m hurdles, and the women's 4x400m relay, long jump, 800m and 60m hurdles. Great Britain's Keely Hodgkinson has been in fine form so far this winter and she will hope to be in contention to retain her title in the 800m, while Netherlands are reigning champions in both the men's and women's relays. With analysis from Jessica Ennis-Hill and Denise Lewis, and commentary by Steve Cram, Andrew Cotter, Steve Backley, Paula Radcliffe and Colin Jackson

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and experts Mark Stacey and Philip Serrel are in Greater Manchester, where over 800 people arrived to have their items valued at Stockport Town Hall. Mark is impressed by a William De Morgan ceramic tile, Paul finds some etchings by artist John Buckland Wright and Philip discovers a gold necklace that surprises everyone at auction

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Giles Coren visit Jade Mountain, a hand-built hotel in St Lucia where each room has no outer wall and so is open to the ocean view - as well as having its own private infinity pool. Giles finds that room service here is tougher than it seems, and Monica dives for lionfish, which they both serve to guests visiting especially to have their wedding on the beach

programme.title: Paul Whitehouse: Our Troubled Rivers
programme.desc: Part one of two. The actor, writer and comedian travels around England and Wales looking at the issues that their rivers and waterways are facing. He begins by visiting the north of England to find out the impact water companies have on rivers, exploring the change in the industry since privatisation in 1989 and what regulations are in place when it comes to sewage discharge. He meets concerned locals looking to highlight the health of the River Wharfe, a conservationist who warns of the ecological decline in iconic Lake Windemere, and singer Feargal Sharkey, who has become a figurehead for the campaign to prevent water companies dumping sewage into UK waterways and seas

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: Documentary by W Kamau Bell offering a deeply personal exploration of actor and comedian Bill Cosby's descent from 'America's Dad' to alleged sexual predator, talking to comedians, educators, journalists and survivors to have a conversation about the man and his crimes. He begins by looking at the 1960s, when Cosby was collecting accolades for his comedy and finding his own ways of participating in the nation's civil rights movement, but all the while he was allegedly beginning to exploit his power.

programme.title: Clemency (2019)
programme.desc: American prison warden Bernadine Williams has presided over a dozen executions. However, as the 13th looms, she grapples with complex emotions while bonding with a death-row inmate who maintains his innocence. Writer/director Chinonye Chukwu's drama, starring Alfre Woodard, Richard Schiff, Danielle Brooks and Michael O'Neill

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary examining the May 1985 bombing of Greenpeace ship Rainbow Warrior, a symbol of peace that had just returned from a visit to the Marshall Islands in the Pacific Ocean, where the inhabitants were suffering the effects of nuclear fallout following the 1954 testing of American H-bomb Bravo. After travelling south to Auckland harbour, New Zealand, two explosions sank the ship and killed a crew member

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: At the mercy of Chauncy and the British, Stede and Blackbeard renounce their pirating ways in a desperate attempt to escape execution. Afterwards, life offshore promises new opportunities, but a late-night confrontation threatens the future of Stede and Blackbeard's friendship. Stuck under the thumb of a new captain, the crew considers mutiny once again

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Comedy starring American rapper and comedian Dave Burd, aka Lil Dicky, as a neurotic suburbanite who thinks he is destined to be one of the world's biggest hip-hop stars - but has a harder time convincing everyone else. While hanging around the music studio where his friend works, Dave meets fellow hanger-on GaTa, who attempts to fill him in on the complicated social dynamics of the rap world. He also promises to get him the chance to perform a guest verse for famous rapper YG, who is currently recording in the studio for one of his songs

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Sunderland to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey coaches the Fall family through getting rid of four years worth of clutter including 2,137 toys, 452 books, 13 guitars, 61 mugs and 1,274 tools. Dad Dan's ADHD has left the house full of unfinished DIY projects leaving children Noah and Rachel feeling miserable. Emotions run high when Dilly presents the family with £2,000 in cash and cheques found hidden in the mess of their overflowing home

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Aspiring makers are given the opportunity to turn their hobbies and skills into money-making businesses. With chronic fatigue syndrome, autism and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder Dea is hoping her willow-weaving can help her build a home business. For artistically inclined Gemma, it's all about proving her careers advisor wrong. Dom Chinea presents

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Sunday Morning Stories
programme.desc: The Rev Kate Bottley shares her favourite tales of faith, hope and spirituality, when ordinary people do extraordinary things

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of commercial diving engineers as they battle time and tide to keep Britain's coastlines and waterways moving. In the first edition, Brighton Marina's main jetty is on the tilt causing chaos for residents and shop owners, so the team devises a plan using air bags to fix it in record time. Young diver Kai reveals how fitness is key to the job they do, and he faces danger when the low tide threatens to bring the concrete jetty down on his head. Craig Parkinson narrates

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Irita Marriott and Mark Hill go treasure hunting in the Fens. Mark falls head over heels for a very stylish, and shiny, mid-century kitchen appliance, while Irita uncovers something so gold, garish and gaudy it may not sell at auction. They also find a collectable with a very grisly and gruesome history

programme.title: Winterwatch
programme.desc: Michaela Strachan celebrates one of Norfolk's most sensational winter species, pink-footed geese. Gillian Burke and Iolo Williams showcase Scotland's marine species on Edinburgh's coast and Megan McCubbin meets the new president of the RSPB, Amir Khan, for a few tips ahead of this weekend's Big Garden Birdwatch

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the game show in which 24 recurring contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the nation's love affair with beer and cider, revealing how at one time it was safer to drink ale than water. The duo are also given a chance to gain hands-on brewing experience at a cider festival

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Kate Humble, Patrick Ayree, scientists and wildlife cameramen examine the changing seasons at Yellowstone National Park during 2016, and the effect on the local American wildlife. In the first episode, Patrick follows the grizzly bears, who are taking a risk with the weather by leaving their winter dens early. Meanwhile, Kate gets to grips with the science behind this frozen season

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce continues to share memorable moments from the long-running series, including ceramics specialist Will Farmer's encounter with members of the Clarice Cliff Collectors Club, affectionately known as the Cliffies. She also examines some of the most unusual items featured on the show

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and his team of experts invite members of the public to bring their antiques to be viewed and valued, with an option to sell at auction

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mina Anwar, Glen Moore, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Shaun Williamson go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: A luxury floating hotel in London's Docklands has a rusty hull and the members of the dive team are charged with making it shipshape once more. They then face danger on the water as they attempt to rescue a stricken cruise liner amid one of winter's worst storms

programme.title: A Special School
programme.desc: The summer term kicks off with a massive water fight, then after months of rehearsing, it's finally time to take to the stage with the big show and the actors try to control their nerves about holding hands and singing. The school takes pupils and families to a funfair and holds a prom featuring axe throwing, while parents reflect on the support that the school offers

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie invites four more contestants to brave the black chair in the final heat, answering questions on the specialist subjects of Christiaan Huygens, Jonathan Creek, the life and works of Artemisia Gentileschi, and European mammals, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell presents as the losing semi-finalists battle it out for third place, with the two teams competing to guess the connections between things that seem utterly random at first glance, with one set of clues asking what comes next in the sequence of Mc/Ball, Nu/Bell, and Gg/Bone

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: In the second of the quarter-finals, two teams of four students compete to make it to the next stage of the contest as they try to win two matches to progress to the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: Forty-five-year-old Jon has been locked up for 19 years after violently robbing three students in 2004. A veteran of six previous parole hearings, he hopes an intense period of therapy has changed him enough for the board to give him a chance this time? Bethany, 23, breached her Criminal Behaviour Order in 2020 after repeatedly threatening to throw herself off motorway bridges, risking her own life and members of the public. Can she convince the board that she isn't a threat to herself or the public anymore?

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Russell and Hugh embark on their mission to recover the mayor's chain of office from the car park in Barnfather Woods. Sophie proves she's still very bad at spying, while Becky and Lance each have something important to tell Andy. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook, Toby Jones, Aimee-Ffion Edwards and Rachael Stirling

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Two Faces of January (2014)
programme.desc: A conman masquerades as a tour guide in Greece, and selects a wealthy American tourist and his younger wife as likely targets. However, when a murder is committed at the couple's hotel, all three are incriminated, and a dangerous alliance develops. Thriller based on Patricia Highsmith's novel, starring Viggo Mortensen, Kirsten Dunst and Oscar Isaac

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: The would-be rapper is finally asked to give his first ever public performance, but the occasion is not exactly what he had always imagined. Elz hesitantly agrees to DJ, while flatmate Mike practices a new skincare routine on Dave

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Celebrating the 70th anniversary of the first recorded summit of the highest point on earth, Mount Everest, Ellie Harrison heads to Kettering and one of the world's most advanced materials research facilities to put outdoor gear - and herself - to the test. As well as getting to grips with a pair of expedition boots that made it to the top of the world, how will Ellie bear up in a cold chamber where the mercury can hit -40 degrees centigrade? Ellie also dips into the Countryfile archive to remember some pretty bracing encounters with the worst the weather can hurl at people

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Entrepreneurs Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett encounter a Berkshire couple hoping to rake in some offers on their multipurpose gardening tool. The Den then turns catwalk, witnessing a fashion show for an adaptive clothing range catering for a variety of disabilities. An app promising to reunite lost dogs with their owners pitches for additional investment, while a plant-based meal delivery service aims to get the Dragons' tastebuds tingling. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The seasoned traveller explores the South American country, beginning in the north-east - where Europeans first landed and grew rich on the profits from sugar and tobacco plantations run with slave labour. In Sao Luis, Michael finds out about a ceremony based on a 200-year-old tale before heading to the coastal lagoons of the Lencois Maranhenses National Park. Journeying inland, he gets a glimpse of the fast-disappearing world of old-style cowboys known as vaqueiros, has his fortune read by a Candomble priest and learns to drum with the Olodum cultural collective

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The Monty Python star continues his first visit to Brazil by travelling by river from the northern border with Venezuela to the capital of Brasilia. Along the way he visits indigenous tribe the Yanomami, learning about the threat to their hunter-gatherer way of life, before watching a rehearsal by the Amazon Philharmonic Orchestra and searching for the remains of Henry Ford's unsuccessful attempt to build a vast rubber plantation in the middle of the rainforest. In Belem, music producer Priscilla explains why Amazonian women are such powerful forces, then he moves southwards, meeting rock star and political activist Dinho Ouro Preto, who believes that despite its social and environmental problems, the country is on the brink of becoming a superpower

programme.title: Paris Police 1905
programme.desc: The Paris vice squad begins to clean prostitutes off the city's streets, only to discover a man's body in the public park. Inspector Antoine Jouin heads up the investigation. In French

programme.title: Paris Police 1905
programme.desc: Lepine asks Jouin to remain discreet in his report of a death to avoid a scandal. Marguerite Steinheil prepares for the opening of a new collection of her husband's work, to which she has invited Lepine. In French

programme.title: A Bit of Fry and Laurie
programme.desc: An angry audience member claims ownership of the episode's sketches. A teenage poet helps a headmaster to express himself and a drug dealer applies for a bank loan

programme.title: A Bit of Fry and Laurie
programme.desc: A lawyer cross-examines a witness, an actor reminisces about the people he's worked with over the years, and a couple at a christening can't decide what to name their child. Irreverent comedy with Stephen Fry and Hugh Laurie

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean spend a nostalgic day in Buckinghamshire reliving their courtship days - but find things have changed in the intervening years. However, certain treasured memories remain. Originally shown in 1992

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The seasoned traveller explores the South American country, beginning in the north-east - where Europeans first landed and grew rich on the profits from sugar and tobacco plantations run with slave labour. In Sao Luis, Michael finds out about a ceremony based on a 200-year-old tale before heading to the coastal lagoons of the Lencois Maranhenses National Park. Journeying inland, he gets a glimpse of the fast-disappearing world of old-style cowboys known as vaqueiros, has his fortune read by a Candomble priest and learns to drum with the Olodum cultural collective

programme.title: Brazil with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The Monty Python star continues his first visit to Brazil by travelling by river from the northern border with Venezuela to the capital of Brasilia. Along the way he visits indigenous tribe the Yanomami, learning about the threat to their hunter-gatherer way of life, before watching a rehearsal by the Amazon Philharmonic Orchestra and searching for the remains of Henry Ford's unsuccessful attempt to build a vast rubber plantation in the middle of the rainforest. In Belem, music producer Priscilla explains why Amazonian women are such powerful forces, then he moves southwards, meeting rock star and political activist Dinho Ouro Preto, who believes that despite its social and environmental problems, the country is on the brink of becoming a superpower

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens reveals how, as the 20th century dawned, artists found radical new ways to depict Wales, pushing themselves to extremes and redefining what art could be. His venture takes him to the National Museum Wales in Cardiff, Bardsey Island off the Llyn Peninsula, Colwyn Bay and Swansea

programme.title: Come Dancing
programme.desc: Terry Wogan introduces another edition of the inter-regional dance contest from 1977, which sees Midlands and West compete against Home Counties North at the Locarno Ballroom, Bradford. Barri Haynes provides the commentary

programme.title: Revisor by Crystal Pite and Jonathon Young
programme.desc: A performance of the critically acclaimed dance-theatre production, created by award-winning choreographer Crystal Pite and playwright Jonathon Young, recorded at Sadler's Wells in March. Revisor is based on the well-known play The Government Inspector by Nikolai Gogol, and Young and Pite revised the archetypal comic plot to serve as the basis for a production that blends contemporary theatre and dance

programme.title: Listening Through the Lens: The Christopher Nupen Films
programme.desc: Documentary about the director who championed classical music on TV, seizing upon his unique access to a generation of musicians. Narrated by Stephen Fry

programme.title: We Want the Light: Jews and German Music
programme.desc: Documentary examining the complex relationship between Jews and German music, from Mendelssohn to Wagner, and the role of music in the German concentration camps

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Rio
programme.desc: Clive visits the Brazilian city of Rio de Janeiro, where the poor live by their wits in the favelas while the wealthy make contact with their less fortunate neighbours only when a servant is paid or a millionaire is mugged

programme.title: Victorian Sensations
programme.desc: Actor Paul McGann explores the 1890s, a decade when science, entertainment, art and morality collided. He discovers how the works of HG Wells, Aubrey Beardsley and Oscar Wilde were shaped by fears of moral, social and racial degeneration, and explains how Wilde sought to subvert traditional Victorian values

programme.title: Patagonia with Huw Edwards
programme.desc: The newsreader follows in the footsteps of settlers who travelled from Wales to Patagonia 150 years ago with the intention of creating a colony where their language and culture would endure. On arrival in South America, Huw meets descendants of the original immigrants and examines how much of their spirit lives on in the present

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: Liz Bonnin marks the 50th anniversary of the construction of the Severn Bridge in a Timeshift special telling the inside story of its design and construction. As the motorway link between England and Wales, the Severn Bridge was described as 'the most perfect suspension bridge in the world', and Liz reveals how its unique, slim-line structure came about by accident

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of the 1930s as he sets out on another adventure. Beginning just outside Newcastle in Jarrow, Michael uncovers the desperation that led 200 men to march 300 miles to Westminster in order to petition the government for work. The first leg of his journey ends Spennymoor, Co Durham, where he meets the son of a miner who became one of the most famous 20th-century artists of the region

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson uncovers the secrets of Thorpeness in Suffolk, the first purpose-built seaside village in the UK. The ingenuity of amenities such as the hand-dug lake, country club and inland housing were the unique vision of Glencairn Stuart Ogilvie. Hamish Ogilvie helps Ben to understand his great-grandfather's vision, stemming from theatrical inspiration

programme.title: Archaeology: A Secret History
programme.desc: Richard Miles charts the history of archaeological breakthroughs in a mission to understand the ancient past. In the first programme, he explores how the profession began by trying to prove a biblical truth

programme.title: Art of France
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon explores how art in France took a dramatic turn after the Revolution ushered in a bold new world of artists including Jacques-Louis David and Theodore Gericault

programme.title: Bent Coppers: Crossing the Line of Duty
programme.desc: Exploring the sleazy underbelly of London's Soho in the early 1970s, where an explosion of dirty pornographic bookshops provides an open invitation for corrupt police to be greedy. With insider interviewers and archive footage, this episode continues to unearth the lawless underworld of 1970s London, audacious levels of police corruption and the birth of the internal force tasked with combating it

programme.title: Big Sky, Big Dreams, Big Art: Made in the USA
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak focuses on the America of small towns and trailer parks, discovering how these much-maligned territories had an immensely beneficial impact on American art. From the small-town brilliance of Grant Wood, to the small-town alienation of Edward Hopper, to the spooky Dust Bowl symbolism of Alexandre Hogue, interstitial America inspired much that was great. The film culminates in the assemblages of David Smith, the leading sculptor of Abstract Expressionism

programme.title: Romancing the Stone: The Golden Ages of British Sculpture
programme.desc: Alastair Sooke examines sculpture in the 20th century, an era of innovation, scandal and creativity. He examines the artistic revolution spearheaded by Eric Gill and Jacob Epstein, which paved the way for the work of Gilbert & George and Damien Hirst. He also explores the art form's rise in popularity, from First World War memorials to the landmark work of Antony Gormley and Rachel Whiteread

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of the 1930s as he sets out on another adventure. Beginning just outside Newcastle in Jarrow, Michael uncovers the desperation that led 200 men to march 300 miles to Westminster in order to petition the government for work. programme.title: Hey You What If?
programme.desc: Telekinesis - the power to be able to move things with your mind - might be popular in films but it's not possible in reality. But what if it was? While watching his favourite show about a villain who can lift anything with mind-power, our hero finds out that he can do it, too. And not only that, he finds out that the villain in the show is real when he goes outside to put the rubbish out. Before long the two are pitched in a mind-power battle in the alley by the recycling bins. As they use their minds to push giant bins at each other, we find out what the laws of physics mean for telekinesis. After all, even non-existent powers would have to obey some of the key rules of physics, like conservation of momentum, conservation of energy and conservation of mass. As our battling duo find out, this means that moving things with your mind would make you very hungry and your legs would buckle if you tried to lift too much. It's by using the laws of physics that our plucky hero is eventually a

programme.title: The Toddler Club
programme.desc: Nigel, Bailee Bear and Benjee Bair welcome toddlers Eesa, Sebastian, Francis, Jemima and Afal, and their grown-ups to the Toddler Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! The What's in the Box? game reveals a photograph of Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear sharing a story, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are all about taking turns. This theme is explored through exploration, play, song and story. Grown-ups are encouraged to take part at home by hiding a safe, toddler-appropriate taking-turns toy or object inside a recycled box for them to reveal and explore with their toddler. Storytime is all about discovering new words, as Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear learn how to play together nicely and the importance of taking turns. Viewers at home show how they've been exploring the taking-turns theme too. Plus, the Benjee and Bailee Say Song gets everyone moving abou

Chantelle visits an aquarium which is home to some rather special jellyfish, whilst Rory meets a marine expert and they head out to sea on a glass-bottomed boat Chantelle and Rory’s fact files help answer all of Carys's questions. With the help of the Teeny Tiny Creatures poem we discover that, like lots of other teeny tiny creatures, jellyfish are superheroes and help our planet in their own special way. In the Teeny Tiny Task, Chantelle and the children pretend to be jellyfish with colourful ribbons.

programme.title: Our Family

Jealous, the Talking Cricket is not happy at first, but he changes his mind as soon as he realises that he can ask him whatever he wants! The Cricket locks Pinocchio and Freeda out of the house, and together with Geppetto, he tests the assistant by asking him the most absurd things. The situation quickly gets out of control... and our heroes have to solve the problem!

programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Mack’s stall. She chooses the bottle-top bowtie and remembers the day she got it. Kez has had another idea – a trash fashion range, and Bob is helping her by bringing in boxes of old clothes. She repays him with a ‘waste coat’ - a waistcoat made entirely out of stuff most people would throw away. Kez is sure that, with Bob wearing it around the Big Hub, it will be a great advert for her range. There’s just one problem: Bob really doesn’t like it. Over at the Kids Club, Ayesha is showing her mum’s accessories to her friends. The kids are inspired and want to make their own. James has to try and find the right materials so asks Mack for help. Mack only has a box of broken toys, but James thinks they might work. Bob tries to dispose of the 'waste coat' when he thinks Kez isn’t looking, but she sees him and is a little upset and takes it back. Bob feels awful and tells Molly what has happened. programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran visit the community garden to pull up the winter vegetables. They get some help harvesting the broccoli and cauliflower from their friends Ellie and Alfie, but it's not time to dig up the carrots because they won't be ready until the spring. However, that doesn't stop the birds from trying to eat them! Alfie scares them off, but he won't be able to be there all the time. Gran Gran comes up with a plan - they can make a scarecrow to keep the birds away.

programme.desc: Documentary following real-life Kings and Queens of the road as they help stack the nation's shops, shelves, construction sites, fuel tanks and kitchen cupboards. The series focuses on the team members at Owens - one of the oldest and biggest haulage companies in Wales. From their base in Llanelli, they run a network that spans the UK, providing hundreds of jobs and turning over £170million a year. In this episode, veteran trucker The Donk has an anxious wait on his wedding anniversary, new recruit Laura puts her reversing skills to the test and MD Ian battles with rocketing fuel bills

programme.title: Casualty

Rash is left struggling with his Dad's welfare after his carer is attacked

In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

Arsenal are battling City for the title, and will have expected a second win of the season against the Cherries. programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: To mark International Women's Day, Claire McCollum visits Glasgow to uncover stories of women of faith throughout the ages, including the city's very own St Enochh, a Scottish princess in the 6th century who survived attempted murder and rape before giving birth to Glasgow's founder, Saint Mungo. Laura Wright meets Glaswegian women who are putting their faith into action

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph is in Surrey, rummaging through the rubbish at the Earlswood Recycling Centre. She enlists the help of Duncan McKean to transform an antique floor lamp and a trolley

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Matt Baker are on the east coast of England to find out how storms are devouring the coastline, putting homes and livelihoods at threat. Tom Heap is in East Anglia, investigating the threat to Britain's breadbasket, while Adam Henson looks into the impact of new farm payments. In the first of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles is in North Wales, finding out just what it takes to be a hill farmer

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents an episode filmed before the Accession, featuring the Queen Consort's visit to the Eden Project to discuss charity project The Big Lunch. Silver specialist Duncan Campbell takes a look at a rare snuffbox from the Royal Collection that was made from Cornish silver, while books expert Justin Croft admires a copy of Gray's Elegy in a Country Churchyard

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Palmer, who went to Tenerife on holiday with his family just before his attempted arrest, learns the police want to speak to him and publicly states his innocence in a television interview. Cooper and Parry successfully move the remaining criminal proceeds from Switzerland to Liechtenstein, but their courier gets caught at the border with the cash. Noye's murder trial comes to a dramatic conclusion

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Manchester United at Anfield and Nottingham Forest v Everton at the City Ground. United were looking to do the double over their fierce rivals for the first time since 2015/16 season after prevailing 2-1 when the sides met at Old Trafford in August. Forest and Everton shared the spoils in a 1-1 draw at Goodison Park, but both teams will have been looking for all three points on this occasion to help ease any relegation concerns. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.desc: A fierce rivalry develops between a talented working-class sprinter and the wealthy daughter of a former Olympic medal-winner as they compete on the track. Drama, with Lily James, Lenora Crichlow, Rupert Graves and Noel Clarke, who also co-wrote the script

programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman host a news-themed episode of the celebrity quiz. Cathy Newman, Keme Nzerem, Lucrezia Millarini, Nina Nannar, Mike Bushell, Kasia Madera, Jennie Bond, Nicholas Owen pair up to come up with the answers that no one else could think of

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Jacob struggles to gain the respect he needs from his department, and feels that Robyn is not putting in the effort she needs to. Stevie is haunted by Marcus' abuse, but Faith helps her to both move forward and see that he suffers some consequences for his crimes. Rash is left struggling with his Dad's welfare after his carer is attacked

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Manchester City v Newcastle United at Etihad Stadium and Arsenal v Bournemouth at Emirates Stadium. The Citizens and Newcastle shared the spoils in a thrilling 3-3 draw at St James' Park in August, but the champions will have hoped to make home advantage count this time around. Arsenal are battling City for the title, and will have expected a second win of the season against the Cherries. Plus, Aston Villa v Crystal Palace, Brighton & Hove Albion v West Ham United, Chelsea v Leeds United, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Tottenham Hotspur and Southampton v Leicester City

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Steven Thompson presents action from the latest fixtures, including Rangers v Kilmarnock, Hearts v St Johnstone and Livingston v Hibernian. With analysis from Neil McCann and James McFadden

programme.title: Going in Style (2017)
programme.desc: Joe Harding, Willie Davis and Albert Garner are lifelong friends who have been swindled out of their pension money by a Brooklyn bank. programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: To mark International Women's Day, Claire McCollum visits Glasgow to uncover stories of women of faith throughout the ages, including the city's very own St Enochh, a Scottish princess in the 6th century who survived attempted murder and rape before giving birth to Glasgow's founder, Saint Mungo. Laura Wright meets Glaswegian women who are putting their faith into action

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph is in Surrey, rummaging through the rubbish at the Earlswood Recycling Centre. She enlists the help of Duncan McKean to transform an antique floor lamp and a trolley

programme.title: Match of the Day Live
programme.desc: Chelsea v Arsenal (Kick-off 3.00pm). All the action from the showpiece match at Selhurst Park. Last season's runners-up Chelsea were in fine form in the semi-finals as they demolished West Ham 7-0 away from home, with Australian star Sam Kerr scoring four of the goals. The Gunners had to work harder for victory in their last-four match, with Stina Blackstenius' extra-time strike enough to give them a 1-0 win over holders Manchester City

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts: A Natural History
programme.desc: Stephen Fry attempts to unfurl all sorts of mysteries around extraordinary beasts and real-life creatures across history, which it is hard to believe could possibly exist. Visiting locations from Utah, USA, to Loch Ness in Scotland, the actor delves into the mythological - such as dragons, mermaids and unicorns - alongside examinations of natural world beasts, such as vervet monkeys, narwhals and manatees. Stephen also chats to JK Rowling about the inspirations behind the creatures populating her hit novels and to visual effects supervisor Christian Manz, who has brought countless magical creations to life

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: John Craven and Matt Baker are on the east coast of England to find out how storms are devouring the coastline, putting homes and livelihoods at threat. Tom Heap is in East Anglia, investigating the threat to Britain's breadbasket, while Adam Henson looks into the impact of new farm payments. In the first of a four-part strand, Adrian Chiles is in North Wales, finding out just what it takes to be a hill farmer

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents an episode filmed before the Accession, featuring the Queen Consort's visit to the Eden Project to discuss charity project The Big Lunch. Silver specialist Duncan Campbell takes a look at a rare snuffbox from the Royal Collection that was made from Cornish silver, while books expert Justin Croft admires a copy of Gray's Elegy in a Country Churchyard

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Palmer, who went to Tenerife on holiday with his family just before his attempted arrest, learns the police want to speak to him and publicly states his innocence in a television interview. Cooper and Parry successfully move the remaining criminal proceeds from Switzerland to Liechtenstein, but their courier gets caught at the border with the cash. Noye's murder trial comes to a dramatic conclusion

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Liverpool v Manchester United at Anfield and Nottingham Forest v Everton at the City Ground. United were looking to do the double over their fierce rivals for the first time since 2015/16 season after prevailing 2-1 when the sides met at Old Trafford in August. Forest and Everton shared the spoils in a 1-1 draw at Goodison Park, but both teams will have been looking for all three points on this occasion to help ease any relegation concerns. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: St Mirren v Celtic. Amy Irons presents action from the match at Simple Digital Arena. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Action from the latest fixtures, including Chelsea v Arsenal in the League Cup final, and Manchester United v Leicester City and Manchester City v Tottenham Hotspur in the WSL

programme.title: Fast Girls (2012)
programme.desc: A fierce rivalry develops between a talented working-class sprinter and the wealthy daughter of a former Olympic medal-winner as they compete on the track. They are forced to settle their differences and work together when they are recruited for the same relay team. Drama, with Lily James, Lenora Crichlow, Rupert Graves and Noel Clarke, who also co-wrote the script

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.title: Crimewatch Live

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In Kent, a police sergeant puts his life in danger when he rescues a man from a house fire, while in Bristol two cops wrestle an armed robber to the ground. In Oxfordshire, after being assaulted by a man he's trying to help, a paramedic has an arranged meeting with the offender

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell examine properties in Surrey, Merseyside and London just prior to them being sold. After they are auctioned, the presenters hear of the new owners' plans for their acquisitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Oswestry in Shropshire, and visits a museum of model cars. Experts Charles Hanson and Ben Cooper assist the teams in finding a bargain

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Rob and Karen plan to surprise everyone and Kirsty and Rich are concerned about Ollie's future. Zara's patient is determined to find her missing parent

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay shares creative and money-saving tips and tricks for the home and garden, including how to build a floating desk and upholster an old stool. Plus, Sarah Moore demonstrates a way to recycle old jars, and Monty Don shares a fantastic method of making a raised bed for the garden

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a buyer from suburban Surrey, who is looking for a new family home with enough land to start a dog training school in south-west Wales. As an alternative to machinery and man hours, Jules also meets a flock of goats for hire capable of clearing an overgrown patch of land in no time at all

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Izzie Balmer sets off on a road trip with new rival jewellery expert Ishy Khan. They kick off in Kendal, with £200 each, looking for antiques that will make them the most profit

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: An intrepid team of four friends competes for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas bring you the stories that matter from across the country

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zack and Whitney say goodbye to their daughter and Sonia enlists the Walford residents to create a condolence box for them. Stacey worries about Lily when she needs a new uniform, but feels more grateful than ever for her family

programme.title: Disclosure
programme.desc: As Scotland emerges from one of the most challenging winters in NHS history, Mark Daly finds patients borrowing cash and dipping into savings to go private, and even travelling abroad for vital surgery. Healthcare is meant to be free for all of us at the point of use but growing numbers of patients face long waits to access the care they need. NHS staff tell their stories from the frontline and explain why many medics are breaking down under the strain of the current crisis

programme.title: Food Fest Scotland
programme.desc: Edith Bowman and Colin Murray explore the Nairn Show to find tips and treats among the food stalls, including how to spot the perfect egg and how to choose the juiciest berries. Elsewhere, chef Julie Lin is on a mission to discover why Scots like their sausages square, and how to find affordable seafood, while farmer Jim Smith raises a glass to non-alcoholic beer, wine and spirits

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Lou makes one last desperate attempt to bring Col down by trying to convince him that the police are coming to raid his house, and that his only hope is to hand over any incriminating evidence to her. However, her plan does not go exactly as she hoped. Feeling powerless, Ceri resorts to drastic action in order to defend his family

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Marianna Spring reports on how Elon Musk's ownership of Twitter is transforming one the world's most influential social media platforms. Current and former insiders in San Francisco and the UK reveal how hate and misogyny are thriving under the new owner, following the dismissal of thousands of staff and the reinstatement of users previously banned for breaking Twitter's rules

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Jane Lewis presents action from the latest fixtures, including Celtic v Glasgow City, Spartans v Rangers and Glasgow Women v Hearts

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: The competition steps up a gear as a new Warrior and Trainee pairing is revealed. The winner of the power challenge sends shockwaves through the group

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: With elimination looming, the power given to one trainee rocks the group, putting them all at risk of being sent home from the island

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The first of two compilations of highlights from the recent series. Among the guests featured are Taylor Swift, Daniel Craig, Eddie Redmayne, Lashana Lynch, Bono, Kate Hudson, Ian McKellen, Paul Mescal, Geena Davis, Stormzy, Lesley Manville, Colin Farrell and Bruce Springsteen
