programme.desc: Manchester 'player' Geo is pulling out all the stops in his attempts to impress 19-year-old Heather - he even brings champagne and flowers. But how will she feel after he tells his favourite joke? Clay-pigeon enthusiast Emma seems a good match for finance broker Jeremy - but soon discovers she has to compete with his work phone - while 82-year-old Harvey isn't letting his age get in the way as he tries to win the heart of lifelong singleton Dinah

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Twenty-one-year-old Dom from Hampshire has been nominated for the show by his mum, in a desperate attempt to break his dismal dating record. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Despite Beverly wanting the two boys to bond, Adam and Johnny Atkins compete for the head of the Highlander Club at school; Barry tries to ensure that the JTP doesn't fall out of touch after high school

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Erica, Barry and Adam are not happy when their distant relative Gleb visits from Russia - until they realise he can make their lives easier. Beverly starts working on her cookbook, which causes tension with the Frentas

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty investigates shock reports that changing sea temperatures mean squid and chips could one day replace fish and chips as the UK's national dish, and heads to Thailand, where squid is a national obsession. Kate Quilton goes Down Under to find out about a surprising new meat coming into our supermarkets and Matt Tebbutt heads to Italy to find out how supermarkets can sell pesto at an affordable price when the traditional ingredients are famously expensive

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman shows London-based Sri Lankan couple Kulan and Kamala five properties for their budget of £200,000 in Portugal's Algarve region. However, it remains to be seen which property has the most 'wow' factor to become the accountants' dream holiday home

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Thomas and Doreen from Sunderland have been dreaming of owning a holiday home in Spain since their first anniversary there 39 years ago. Scarlette Douglas searches far and wide to find them the perfect property in eastern Andalucía for their £55,000 budget. But will it be a modern apartment near the sea or a traditional cave house in the countryside that wins their hearts?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Mark and Maggie have been together for 35 years and are looking for a holiday home in Barbados, where they can escape British winters and make the most of the tropical climate. With a budget of £350,000, Jasmine Harman uses her extensive knowledge of the island to find the best properties for the pair to choose between

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples searching in Sheffield. Scientists Lois and Ahmed's strategic approach has so far seen them lose out on eight houses, being outbid by just a few thousand pounds each time. With a toddler in tow, and living with Lois's parents, the heat is on for Kirstie to find their own family home. Phil is with Liz and Luke, who are set on the rural areas around the city, close to the Peak District

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alex Sullivan hosts the first party in Chelmsford, Essex, hoping to impress with her birthday party-themed evening. However, an uncomfortable reunion between two former school friends gets the night off to a bad start, and a less than satisfactory dessert leaves the host with little to celebrate

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businessman Scott Johnson hosts an 'Essex Glam-themed' night for the second dinner party of the week in Chelmsford, Essex. His menu initially impresses his guests, until they realise he has taken some shortcuts with his preparations. However, a bigger problem emerges when former classmates John Mabey and Martin Young renew old hostilities, so Scott tries to lighten the mood by taking everyone for a dance in 'Essex's smallest disco' - his kitchen

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Deb Croghan hosts the third dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, and hopes to impress her guests with a tarts and vicars-style evening. Following an uncomfortable game of guessing everyone's age, she perks up the evening with an unusual entertainment - a cucumber-based sport she claims is a traditional family pastime

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Twenty-five-year-old hot-tub salesman John Mabey hosts the fourth dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, setting out to woo his guests with a Shakespearean evening featuring an Italian-style menu, but when his food comes close to a complete fiasco, he turns to theatrics to save the day - including asking his guests to act out Romeo and Juliet

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Martin Young hosts the final dinner party in Chelmsford, Essex, hoping to impress his guests by throwing a Caribbean-themed evening. The diners are pleasantly surprised by the quality of his food and shocked when he reveals a secret talent, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at the Holland Hall Hotel in Upholland, Lancashire, where two of the guests are less than impressed when the breakfast table is laid with steak knives

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Railway Inn near Hull in East Yorkshire, where young couple Lydia Perkins and Luke Mainprize feel the pressure at breakfast time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Driftwood B&B in Weymouth, where guest Lygia prepares to party when she spies the host's disco balls

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the Bull Hotel in Wrotham, Kent, where owner Lygia Fontanella-Deadman prides herself on a luxury stay. But a surprise leads to criticism from one couple

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Genice and Cathy want Lydia and Luke to shed some light on the wardrobe situation

programme.title: Home Greek Home
programme.desc: Sarah Moore renovates a house on the Greek island of Skiathos after buying it without seeing it during lockdown. Having spent many years holidaying and working on the island, Sarah has developed a deep connection to Skiathos and has long dreamt of owning a house there. The family visit the house for the first time and learn about the complications that come with renovating a house in a country with different rules and regulations

programme.title: Amanda Owen's Farming Lives
programme.desc: Amanda visits Llyr Jones' hill farm in north Wales and learns how he has focused on making a profit and protecting the environment since taking over the farm as a teenager. She works alongside Vicky and Sian in the egg packing unit, on an early morning calf-feeding routine and rounding up sheep while taking a crash course in Welsh language sheep dog commands

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Zaki, 63, recently underwent a tonsillectomy following a diagnosis of throat cancer, but he has come to A&E after suffering a serious bleed. Doctors try to save 10-month-old baby Amy, who stopped breathing at home, while 21-year-old expectant father Craig appears to have had a miraculous escape after a motocross accident, but has he learnt his lesson?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Eighty-four-year-old Paula is referred to St George's for urgent treatment, after a routine blood test detected that she has a dangerously high level of potassium in her blood. Meanwhile, 74-year-old Derek is brought into A&E after suffering a suspected stroke. As he goes for emergency surgery, his devoted wife Mary is determined to help him recover. Plus, 31-year-old fireman Glenn arrives with a suspected abscess in his throat; he is joined by his twin brother Dean, and the pair prove to be inseparable

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a festive edition of the comedy panel show's version of the popular and long-running words-and-numbers quiz. Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent takes her usual place in Dictionary Corner with David O'Doherty, while mathematics whizz Rachel Riley is on hand to provide the letters and numbers

Now that they are finally in a position to buy a holiday home in the Mar Menor in Spain, Jasmine Harman is on hand to show them five properties for their £70,000 budget

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a Yorkshire couple who plan to transform a goods wagon into a summerhouse and gin bar, and visits a narrowboat conversion in Buckinghamshire. George's Spanish tour reaches Madrid, where he meets a man who has spent the past 50 years building a cathedral by hand. Plus, work continues on the expandable caravan pod

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: George meets Matt and Kevin, whose 1930s home stands out for all the wrong reasons. Sitting alongside the elegant Victorian and Edwardian properties in south-west London, this three-up, three-down is ugly from the outside and even worse on the inside, with dark, dated and badly designed spaces. Architects Katerina Dionysopoulou and Billy Mavropoulos are brought in to make most radical transformation on the programme to date - but will their wildly ambitious poured-concrete extension prove too innovative for the owners?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: George visits a Grade-II listed worker's cottage in Hampshire, as his mission to future-proof historic houses continues. Due to restrictions on planning permissions, the property has become somewhat disorganised, and is in need of a careful makeover. Seeking inspiration, George tours a Victorian stable that was renovated to add a gym, cinema and roof garden, and heads to a farmhouse in East Sussex to view a smart and stylish solution to the problem of designing new, accessible bathrooms for period properties

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marketing manager Clair Sherwood-Parkin hosts the first party in Darlington, Co Durham, hoping to impress with a Moroccan-inspired feast. However, one guest causes a stir when she introduces herself as the Queen of Sheba, and Clair's party game unearths some shocking truths about her diners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Veterinary surgeon James Emson hosts the second party in Darlington, Co Durham, and decides to accompany his curry main course with a gruesome contest in which he serves up a selection of eyeballs, tongues and other bits of offal, then challenges his guests to identify which animal they came from. Diner Barry l'Anson also manages to leave the party having achieved a lifetime ambition

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barry I'Anson hosts the third dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, and hopes his love-themed evening will endear him to his guests. Unfortunately for him Clair Sherwood-Parkin is not impressed and begins doubting the host's masculinity, and vet James Emson is concerned what the dessert will be like. Charlotte Langley finds herself wanting a sick bag before the evening is over, and Eseyoma Sodje steals the show during some cringe-worthy entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Charlotte Langley hosts the fourth dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, and asks her guests to attend dressed as their favourite red-carpet celebrity, but as the night progresses, she discovers she is not very good at taking criticism and a tense situation threatens to get out of hand

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Eseyoma Sodje hosts the final dinner party in Darlington, Co Durham, hoping her Nigerian recipes and a hint of glamour will impress her guests. To further improve her chances of bagging the £1,000 prize, she puts on a round of hip-hop karaoke, before the winner is announced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Sancton, East Yorkshire and The North Star Club, owned by Carolyn Van Outersterp, who is joined in the competition by her daughter Galatea, where they hope their peaceful woodland cabins win over their guests. On arrival, guests Luke and John are critical of the cleanliness, and the pricing of the rooms raise eyebrows. At dinner, the reveal of a self-catering breakfast ruffles some feathers, but it's the lack of wi-fi that divides the guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Friends B&B in Blackpool, Lancashire, run by Luke and John Conway, where a lack of attention to detail in the rooms leaves one critic unimpressed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at The Lincoln Holiday Retreat, where guests Luke and John's great first impressions are muddied due to cleanliness concerns

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Chapel in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, whose owners Mark Hinchliffe and Heidi Donohoe, pride themselves on offering something a little different in their converted chapel. On arrival, the guests are wowed by the interior and artwork on show. However, Luke and John discover some grime underneath the glamour and Debbie is concerned about her traditional Chinese bed. At dinner, all the guests congratulate Mark and Heidi on their pretty property, but things soon turn ugly when talk turns to the looming payment day as it becomes clear that the B&B'ers have grievances to air

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. The North Star Club is first and owner Carolyn Van Outersterp has some cleanliness issues she wants to brush up on after receiving a score of one earlier in the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five cooks compete for the £1,000 prize in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and keen basketball player Ken Oputa is the first to host, inviting his guests to turn up in sportswear fancy dress. He hopes his Double Dribble mushrooms and Slam Dunk salmon will prove to be winning ingredients

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Interior designer Erika Sager hosts the second dinner party of the week on board her boat in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and invites her guests to dress up as pirates. Despite the unconventional setting, her rivals are all impressed by the standard of her food and hospitality

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-two Sarah Brice hosts the third dinner party in Kingston upon Thames, hoping to impress her guests with her own take on dishes including prawns, lamb and chocolate mousse. Ken Oputa tries to make an impression on the female contestants with his romantic poetry, but finds Erika Sager switches her attentions to his rival Jamie Baker

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Photographer Jamie Baker hosts the fourth party in London, and his ambitious menu of langoustine and crab ravioli, herb crusted rack of lamb, and milloux of chocolate - combined with his choice of evening entertainment - go down well, until an unexpected turn of events scuppers his plans

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired golfer David Witcher hosts the final evening in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and hopes to impress with an American-themed menu, including Wyoming slow-cooked ribs and Louisiana seafood chowder. After dinner, he entertains his guests with a bucking bronco, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Medics fly to the aid of mountain biker Rob in the Cumbrian mountains. Off-road motorbiker Dean is set to miss his friend's 50th birthday celebrations after taking a nasty tumble. Plus, 15-year-old Robbie needs urgent care when he falls from a coastal cliff in South Shields

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Keen young rugby player Robert has a dangerously high heart rate and may need to have a pacemaker fitted - a scary thought for the nine-year-old's father. Mark, 32, has fallen 30ft from scaffolding while doing some DIY, and there's concern he may have damaged his spine. Christine, 74, arrives in A&E after an accident in her garden, and she's suffered nasty injuries to her face

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The team at St George's treats patients who have injured themselves through work or play. Iain, 60, is rushed in by ambulance after falling 10ft off a ladder on to his head while fixing an air-conditioning unit. He has a deep laceration above his right eye and doctors can't guarantee he won't lose some of his sight. Student teacher Lloyd is helped into A&E by his friend Mollie after injuring his foot on an inflatable obstacle course on their last day at university. Lucy has had a trampolining accident in her family's garden and medics fear the 13-year-old may have suffered a neck injury

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Compilation episode of the most dramatic incidents the medics have dealt with, including a man who had to be put into an induced coma after a freak car accident, a woman trapped in her car and a crash on a country road that required the helicopter medics to be diverted from a training mission

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp enlists the help of paper-cutting expert Poppy Chancellor to make personalised wedding invitations for a couple about to tie the knot. Plus, the inventive presenter creates a craft collage to celebrate the arrival of a newborn baby

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: After a road trip along the Spanish coastal region of Almeria, Frans and Julie Mampaeij from Berkshire completely fell in love with this part of the country. Now they want to seize the day and buy a holiday home here. With a cash budget of £90,000, Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties for them to choose between

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A Glasgow couple face a major renovation project at their Italian rural retreat, while a couple from Brighton take on the French at their own game by opening a cheese and wine bar

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Dumfries to meet Maggie, whose farm holds an extraordinary collection of memorabilia

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Pembrokeshire to meet a cattle breeder whose barns include a pair of discarded horns, and a camper van fan with a vintage pedal car

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Friends of a glamorous south London woman who once travelled the world, call in the probate detectives to try to find her family. Meanwhile, the search for relatives of a silk weaver's son is jeopardised by a surprise revelation. Plus, details of two unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at Brockley Hall Hotel in Saltburn-by-the-Sea, North Yorkshire, where owner Heather Garcia and manager Sally Lewis hope to impress their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Alistair Richardson welcomes his rivals to his family owned B&B, The Star Inn 1744, in Thrussington, Leicestershire. The refurbished village pub impresses Steve and Tracy, but Heather and Sally's stay gets off to a far from spotless start

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week takes place at Croft Farm Park in Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire, where owners Jason and Michelle Jones are keen to show off their new luxury lodges

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests arrive at Harbour Vista in Poole, Dorset, where most of them have been expecting something lavish - so they are surprised to be staying in owner Steve Webster's house

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time, to find out how much they've been paid and to settle some scores. Heather and Sally from Brockley Hall Hotel want some answers about why one of their rooms didn't scrub up. Plus, Alistair from The Star Inn 1744 queries his guests' cleanliness comments

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Catching up with two sets of house-hunters who battled the property markets either side of the Thames. In 2018, Emily and Dustin had saved a healthy deposit, but in the north London market, they were finding it hard to secure their first home. In 2009, it was all about location for Sarah and Ian. Fixated on their beloved Balham, but without the budget for two bedrooms, Phil Spencer had to employ some creative thinking in order to fulfil their wish list. Now he returns to find out how they have got on since cameras stopped rolling

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: In the first episode of a new series, Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Rowland family in Stoke-on-Trent who are unsure whether to sell their home or renovate their current property instead. Hospital worker Julie is unhappy with their house and longs to live in a spacious character property, but Allen does not think they will find anything better than what they currently have within in their budget. After a decade long debate, can Phil and Kirstie help the pair make the right decision?

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Arthur and Dorothy are now seven and eight, and growing up fast. They will soon need separate bedrooms - so Angel comes up with an ingenious plan to create a mezzanine. As the re-slating of the roof continues, Dick and Angel not only launch into knocking down walls and building new ones but preserving old wallpaper, creating memory furnishings from the kids' old clothes, as well as finding time to pick some strawberries in the garden

programme.title: Grand Designs: Living in
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud looks at the challenges of self-building in the countryside, where design must embrace and enhance tradition, yet often overcome stringent planning constraints. Drawing on footage from the show, as well as new visits to extraordinary homes, he finds out how pioneers at the forefront of architecture are transforming agricultural and historic buildings, and bringing cutting-edge contemporary design to rural parts

programme.title: World's Greatest Train Journeys from Above
programme.desc: A journey across Manitoba from South to North. The Winnipeg to Churchill train is filmed from above as it winds through snow-covered grasslands, Canada's Boreal Forest and into the frozen barren lands, just below the Arctic Circle. It's a constant struggle to keep on track as engineers battle with snow and ice in temperatures that reach as low as minus 45

programme.title: Chernobyl: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring catalogue of errors that occurred in the run-up to the nuclear disaster, examining newly declassified evidence from the KGB archives about the safety of the plant. The programme examines concerns that had been voiced while the nuclear plant was still under construction, but which were ignored by the Soviet leaders

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Becky, 59, is rushed in after a suspected stroke, and medics are concerned she may have had a bleed on the brain. Georgia, 19, locked herself out of her flat and lost her balance trying to climb through a second-floor window, falling 20ft on to concrete. She's sent for an urgent CT scan with possible spinal injuries. Meanwhile, 88-year-old Edith is kept under observation after collapsing at home

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedic Sam Grimson and student paramedic Ayaz Ali spend more than a third of their 12-hour shift treating an intoxicated man in Birmingham. In Coventry, an 89-year-old woman refuses to go to hospital despite her continuous vomiting. Plus a 93-year-old war veteran seeks medical attention for sepsis that could kill him

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Vic Reeves and Aisling Bea join host Jimmy Carr and team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson for more comic innuendos, unpredictable conundrums and unforgivable puns in the comedy quiz. David O'Doherty is with Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Becky, 59, is rushed in after a suspected stroke, and medics are concerned she may have had a bleed on the brain. programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Marianne and Anthony from West Yorkshire search for their perfect holiday home in the Axarquia region of southern Spain

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Pro driver Shane Lynch takes on engineer Ralph Hosier and his teams of mechanics, who are aiming to prove a supercar can be beaten by homemade scrap. This time, they get down and dirty in an off-road scramble versus the Bentley Bentayga - can a car synonymous with class and style be beaten by cars made from cast-offs?

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef begins an exploration of the country's food in the states of West Bengal and Tamil Nadu, where the influence of the British Empire on eating habits can still be observed. Rick enjoys the prominence of fish and seafood in the cuisine found in the cities of Kolkata and Chennai, cooking dishes including prawns in coconut milk and his mum's British Raj curry

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: At Golitha Falls, where the River Fowey tumbles down to the sea, Rick meets Dawn French, who has made Cornwall her home. In the shadow of Devonport Dockyard, he boards the world's busiest chain ferry to cross the wide River Tamar, the ancient watery boundary between Devon and Cornwall - along the way discovering an unusual event involving circus elephant. And he meets a man who thinks he has discovered the next superfood, which Rick used to cook up a delicious duck dish

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compare the Mercedes SLS, the Porsche 911 GT3 RS and the Ferrari 458 Italia, as they race against each other in an epic road trip up America's east coast

programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pal's return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: When Charlie's school gets a bad Ofsted rating, Lee and Lucy start looking around for alternative schools. Despite Frank's protests, Geoffrey and Wendy offer to pay to send Charlie to be privately educated, which presents Lee and Lucy with a moral dilemma

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee interrupts Lucy's favourite TV programme by plonking himself down next to her on the sofa, eating her chocolates and talking loudly all the way through the dialogue. programme.title: Would I Lie to You?

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Hugh Dennis feature in a special edition of the topical comedy show featuring fond favourites, outtakes and other previously unseen bits

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Engineer Ralph Hosier champions two teams of car lovers on their mission to design and build scrap vehicles capable of beating pro-driver Shane Lynch's supercar in a daring challenge. This time, they take on the iconic Lamborghini Huracan Performante in a handling head to head. Their mechanical ingenuity and driving skills are put to the ultimate test as they race against both the supercar and the clock

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick heads into the county's china clay pits to discover what is known locally as white gold, one of its most important industries. He then climbs the Cornish Alps, huge slag heaps created by the clay mining and some of Cornwall's highest land. After a wild swim at one of Cornwall's picturesque hidden coves, Rick cooks a simple sea bass recipe, revealing how to make the perfect mayonnaise. In the far west of the county, on the Land's End peninsula, Rick meets his niece, a modern artist, who explains her deep spiritual connection to Cornwall

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the post-war British modern art movement in the seaside town of St Ives, the home for leading artists such as Barbara Hepworth and Terry Frost. At the Lizard Peninsula, Rick heads out to sea to fish for red mullet, and on the wild coast at Land's End, he discovers why Cornwall has a rather unusual animal as its national emblem

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the Roseland Peninsula, beginning at a spot believed by some to have been visited by Jesus Christ. He tours the bay of St Mawes with Alex and Olga Polizzi, who own one of Cornwall's most luxurious hotels, and meets one of the county's oldest butchers, who demonstrates the ancient practice of aging meat. Finally, in the harbourside village of Mousehole, Rick meets a potter who finds inspiration from the local landscape

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill. This round comes from St Patrick's Hill in Cork as competitors hope their vehicles have what it takes to clinch victory

programme.title: Top Gear

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: It's been over a year since Frank's death and Wendy, rediscovering a long lost love for painting, decides to create a very unique tribute to him in oils. The usually curmudgeonly Geoffrey seems very keen on the commemorative artwork, but Lee and Lucy simply hate it. Once it's hanging on their wall, the pair contrive to 'lose' the painting without Wendy or Geoffrey noticing. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Deborah Grant and Geoffrey Whitehead

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lucy is worried Lee is becoming isolated and friendless after noticing he makes no effort to talk to other parents in the playground. She encourages him to make an effort to bond with them and he reluctantly agrees to give it a try. He opens up with strangers and makes friends with another lone male, Keith. However, Keith is even less sociable than Lee. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton, with Joe Wilkinson

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Confined to a wheelchair, his right leg encased in plaster after knee surgery, Lee has too much time on his hands, which he uses to watch the world go by through a pair of high-powered binoculars. He soon realises that all is not well in his neighbour's house opposite - in fact, he's quickly convinced that something despicable is going on. Instalment of the hit comedy with overtones of Hitchcock's Rear Window, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner welcomes Strictly Come Dancing head judge Len Goodman, actress and impressionist Ronni Ancona and quick-witted comic Tim Vine to discuss their pet hates, in the hope of having them banished to Room 101. Their gripes include cats in the garden, karaoke DJs, foreign food and small talk at parties

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Grumpy comic Jack Dee, footballer-turned-presenter Gary Lineker and actress Fay Ripley reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include white-van drivers, competitive parents and people who tell the truth

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Outdoor survival expert Ray Mears, TV presenter Fiona Bruce and comedienne Katherine Ryan tell Frank Skinner what really gets on their wick, in the hope he will banish their bugbears to the infamous room for ever. The celebrities' gripes include caravans, cushions on beds and Cheryl

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Germany, learning about an Edwardian fitness craze in Dresden before heading to Leipzig on a historic line built by British engineers in 1839. He discovers model-railway making on the grandest of scales in Hamburg and ends his journey in Kiel, where he reveals how British yachtsmen spied on the German navy in the early 20th century

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores Scandinavia, braving one of the world's oldest rollercoasters in Copenhagen's Tivoli Gardens. He then crosses the Oresund Bridge linking Denmark to Sweden, retracing the journey of a train that carried a revolutionary Russian passenger on an epic voyage, before test-driving a vintage Volvo in Gothenburg. Crossing into Norway, Michael discovers how in 1913 the nation expressed its distinctively modern identity in plays, paintings and polar exploration

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Bohemia and Bavaria, beginning by exploring the art nouveau architecture of Czech Republic capital Prague. He then samples the sulphurous spa waters and wallows in peat and mud in Marianske Lazne, formerly known as Marienbad, before test driving a state-of-the-art passenger train made at the Skoda factory in Pilsen. Crossing the border into Germany, Michael encounters a fire-breathing dragon in Furth-im-Wald, and learns about an early 20th-century pioneer who laid the foundations for Munich's pre-eminence in science and technology

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets out to sample the delights of the Atlantic coasts of Spain and France, beginning in Bordeaux, where he uncovers a historic British connection to the region's wines. Across the border in San Sebastian, Michael learns how diplomacy brought Britain and Spain closer together and rides on a hair-raising scenic railway. Heading to Bilbao, he explores the industrial ties between France and Spain and learns to cook a traditional Basque dish

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures once more on to the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide, beginning by travelling through Russia. He starts in the industrial city of Tula, before visiting Leo Tolstoy's former home of Yasnaya Polyana and learning how the author's life and works were intertwined with the railways. Michael then boards the train that runs from the Caspian Sea to Moscow, where he performs an important role in a dramatic opera at the Bolshoi Theatre, before exploring the beauty and history of St Petersburg and riding on the first railway ever built in Russia

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Steered by his 1913 Bradshaw railway guide, Michael Portillo takes the train down the spine of Italy as he travels from Rome to Sicily. He begins by weaving among the capital city's landmarks on the back of a 1950s Vespa, before boarding the train south to Naples, where he finds out about the first railway to be built in the country, and ventures into the crater of Mount Vesuvius. He takes a detour to the island of Capri, before finishing his journey in the ancient hilltop town of Taormina

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels to leafy Hatch End in north-west London, where he meets the great-nephew of the famous illustrator William Heath Robinson. programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil look back on some of their most interesting renovations and house-hunts, starting with Sophie and Paul in Aylesbury, who were divided over their three-bed house which Paul bought himself. After meeting Sophie and having two children together, Paul decided he wanted to move into a bigger and better family home while Sophie wanted to stay in the area with her family nearby. Amy and Louis in Cowbridge, Wales were in turmoil over their period home which Louis had inherited from his late grandmother. The house held many memories for Louis but with his recent diagnosis and the upkeep required, Amy doubted it could be a long-term home for them

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets master carpenter Olaf, who is facing the biggest challenge of his career - creating an oasis for himself and partner Fritha on a small slice of land in West Sussex, which happens to be surrounded by a mainline railway and a busy A-road. Not only that, but half of the plot can't even be built on due an underground mains sewer. All they're left with is a very small triangle on which to build their future life together. With £190,000 in the bank, Olaf and Fritha must use all the ingenuity they can muster to make their triangular three-bedroom house come to life

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown

programme.desc: Following three patients who have adapted to the challenges thrown their way, including 27-year-old Josh, who was rushed to A&E after being thrown from his motorbike at speed. Georgie has brought in her 10-month-old son Phoenix after she caught him sucking on a bleach tablet, while 21-year-old Ross is in A&E after dislocating his shoulder at work

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 56-year-old woman is rushed to St George's with an open ankle fracture after falling in her garden, and a man suffering chest pains looks back on his career on the railway, which was cut short by a leg amputation. An 84-year-old man collapses at home following a bout of dizziness, and his children reflect on the challenges of watching his health decline in recent years

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc: Alice Levine continues to explore the sex lives of others, discovering out-of-the-ordinary love stories from across the world. In this first episode, she dives into new, advanced technologies that could be what sex and relationships will look like in the future, meeting a couple in Berlin who opened the world's first cyber-brothel, populated by talking sex dolls. She heads to Las Vegas to witness the next generation of sex-robots and also meets a couple whose relationship exists in a virtual 'furry' universe, but who are about to risk it all, taking their love affair offline and moving across the world to be together IRL (In Real Life)

programme.title: Send Nudes: Body SOS
programme.desc: Using ground-breaking technology, individuals considering cosmetic surgery get to see themselves like they have never seen before through full-size avatars of their naked bodies. In the opening episode, Vogue Williams meets chiselled carpenter Steven, who wants a porn star-sized penis, and single mum Steph, who is desperate for smaller boobs. But as they both confront their life-size naked avatars, will they decide to push ahead with their plans for surgery or will their minds be changed by what they see in front of them?

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip

He also joins the workforce at Europe's biggest building site and the Hinkley Point C nuclear power station, finding out why reactors are so expensive and take 10 years to build, and works inside Britain's most toxic site - handling nuclear waste inside the Sellafield facility

programme.desc: The final group of singletons check in searching for their perfect partners. They include an Oxford maths undergraduate looking for a good listener - and preferably someone tall - and a hair salon owner who wants someone with whom he can start a family. Also arriving is Elissa, a master of ceremonies for dinners, birthdays and, indeed, weddings. Will her own big day be just around the corner after meeting am-dram enthusiast Rob?

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz as Richard Ayoade and Sara Pascoe take on Jon Richardson and Chris McCausland. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate, aided by Morgana Robinson in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets master carpenter Olaf, who is facing the biggest challenge of his career - creating an oasis for himself and partner Fritha on a small slice of land in West Sussex, which happens to be surrounded by a mainline railway and a busy A-road. Not only that, but half of the plot can't even be built on due an underground mains sewer. All they're left with is a very small triangle on which to build their future life together. With £190,000 in the bank, Olaf and Fritha must use all the ingenuity they can muster to make their triangular three-bedroom house come to life

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud visits a couple planning to build a home that looks like a work of art overlooking a valley in south Devon. Joe and Claire's new home will be a giant sculpture inspired by the local landscape, 70 metres long and featuring 34 enormous angled zinc shards jutting out in all directions. It will also be complicated to build and equally as expensive. And although Joe is wealthy, ambitious and fearless, his team quickly come up against problems and the budget virtually doubles the first walls go up. Is his dream home in danger of become a nightmare?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition visits the Nottingham and Derby area. American Hali kicks proceeding off with a travel-inspired menu, including Moroccan chicken cigars and an unusual dessert combination. With a very gregarious gathering of guests, the food plays second fiddle to a fun night of impressions, dance moves and kitchen chaos

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition continues in the Nottingham and Derby area. Car salesman Alistair hopes to step the competition up a gear. However, after narrowly avoiding an argument last night with Lesley, the veteran of the group, he's treading on thin ice. And he's serving up a bizarre menu, including chilli soup - for dessert - and prunes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Nottingham, fun-loving funeral arranger Kim hosts an evening packed with games galore and a mixed bag menu. Fifty-seven-year-old Lesley is again the butt of car salesman Alistair's geriatric jibes and takes great delight in watching him put on the spot during a dance-off

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Customer relations associate and part-time drag queen Adam plans a theatrical night of flamboyance as the culinary competition continues in the Derby and Nottingham area. Can he get his guests begging for an encore, will Alastair and Lesley ever kiss and make up and what will Adam's guests think of his secret hobby as a ufologist?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final soiree in the Nottingham and Derby area sees 57-year-old Lesley counting on a night of glamour and glitz - plus some good home-cooked food - to secure the £1,000 prize. However, before any food is even dished up, the guests make a surprising discovery about the host

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Married couple Cliff Walker and Angela Adkin from Nottingham fell in love with St Lucia when they were on a Caribbean cruise, and now, after discovering their pensions aren't performing as well as they'd like, they've decided to invest in a property there. Can Jasmine Harman find a place that will be a sound investment and also give them and their family an idyllic holiday home for years to come, all for their £120,000 budget?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Leah Charles-King is in Spain's Orihuela Costa to help Donna and Graeme find their perfect holiday home. They're after a light and airy two or three-bedroom apartment. Leah seeks out five impressive properties for the couple's budget of £75,000

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: In Spain, yoga teacher Tessa risks everything as she tries her hand at hosting weddings from her brand new luxury location. In Portugal, restaurant owners Romain and Ana, who struggled with the impact of Covid, are finally starting to reap the rewards of their hard work

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition comes from in and around north London, where first host, 45-year-old estate agent Suzie, is hoping to wow her guests with an evening dedicated to her mixed heritage

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Michael hosts the second night in north London, hoping his Italian-inspired menu featuring homemade pasta and chocolate fondant will win over his guests, but his entertainment is the star of the show

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third host of the week is Shivz who is hoping her tried and tested menu full of favourites will impress her guests. With talk at the table turning to pelicans, politics, professions and punchlines, will Shivz's cooking and poolside party be enough to win them over?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the penultimate night in and around north London, insurance underwriter Fraser treats his guests to an Asian-inspired menu. There's a clash over cruises, stand-up surprises and a sunset singalong, but will Fraser's cooking be enough for him to grab the £1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final night in and around north London, public relations executive Melissa presents her menu of Greek Cypriot classics. After a week of shocking singing, bad piano playing and even worse impressions, it's up to Melissa to show that she has what it takes to win the £1,000 prize

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Kent couple Alison and Lee are making a permanent move to the stunning countryside of Albox in Almería. They need a garden that's secure enough for their four dogs to roam safely, and the property must be big enough to host their six grown-up children and three grandchildren. Ben Hillman lines up some impressive properties for their budget of £150,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: With their children having left home, Maureen and Brian Kellengher want to downsize and enjoy their retirement. However, while they love the idea of staying close to family and friends along the Suffolk-Essex border, they're excited about starting a whole new life in Lanzarote. Jonnie Irwin shows them three beautiful properties for their budget of £320,000 to tempt them to stay in the UK and Jasmine Harman goes all out with three properties for £225,000 in Lanzarote

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets master carpenter Olaf, who is facing the biggest challenge of his career - creating an oasis for himself and partner Fritha on a small slice of land in West Sussex, which happens to be surrounded by a mainline railway and a busy A-road. programme.title: Matt Baker: Our Farm in the Dales
programme.desc: The male lambs need to be separated from the females. Molly and Nicola help Janice to bring some freshly laid eggs to the barn, where they'll need to be incubated before hatching into the next generation of rare-breed chickens. The final stages of the hay harvest begin, and Matt surprises his dad Mike with a trip to the restoration garage to see what he's been up to with his 1946 Dodge

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: It's the semi-final and the potters are making pieces for the bathroom before taking on the iconic Moorcroft tube lining in the surprise second challenge. Judges Keith Brymer Jones and Rich Miller have a tough choice deciding who will go through to the following week's grand finale

programme.title: Gogglebox

programme.title: George Michael: Outed
programme.desc: Part one of two. How the singer's outing was a landmark moment in gay politics, with a potential career-ending scandal being averted by seizing control of the media narrative. The first episode looks back at the singer's early career, and unearths the reasons he felt compelled to remain in the closet in the first place. Featuring contributions from former manager Simon Napier-Bell and Rev Richard Coles, who recalls his own experiences of being a gay man and a pop star in the 1980s

programme.title: Sex Actually with Alice Levine
programme.desc: Alice travels from London to Washington, DC meeting people who are entering relationships with multiple partners in a bid for more sex and a deeper connection, including a 20-person polycule - a group of open-minded lovers who have created an ever-evolving support system through their intertwined sex lives. programme.title: Murder, She Wrote

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote

programme.title: Columbo

Crime drama, with Peter Falk and Theodore Bikel

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The crumpled cop investigates when a private eye murders his client's adulterous wife because she refuses to submit to his blackmail threats, and arranges the crime scene to make it look as if she was the victim of a mugging gone wrong. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Ray Milland and Robert Culp

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A woman who has devoted her life to running her family's museum is outraged when her brother decides to sell it. Knowing of someone with criminal connections, she arranges to have her brother killed. However, just when she starts to think she has got away with it, a certain shabby sleuth is assigned to the case. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Joyce Van Patten, Celeste Holm and Tim O'Connor

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: Oscar-winning composer Findlay Crawford relies on his assistant Gabriel to do all the hard work, but the younger musician demands recognition. Detective drama, with Peter Falk and Billy Connolly

programme.title: Columbo

He thinks he has the perfect alibi, claiming that the victim was murdered while they were talking to each other on the phone, and there is a tape recording to prove it - but his ruse fails to fool the dishevelled detective. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, William Shatner and Molly Hagan

programme.title: Dork Hunters from Outer Space
programme.desc: Alien Dorks disguise themselves as humans to use Earth as a base to take over the universe, but they face opposition from some unlikely teenage heroes

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: An astronaut seemingly returns from the dead and directs the crew toward a planet resembling Earth - but the promised idyll soon proves fraught with danger. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six becomes a pawn in a human game of chess while trying to recruit an army of like-minded souls - and learns to judge the Villagers' allegiances by their moves. Cult drama, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: Fern, a beautiful blue Burmese and one of the Cat Hospital's oldest patients takes a turn for the worse. Franklin, a prize-winning Maine coon, a novice when it comes to females meets Ruby - but will romance ensue? Veterinary specialist Clare Meade meets a visiting cat called Honey

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: Hitler's Bodyguard
programme.desc: Documentary series investigating how the Nazi leader managed to escape assassination more than 40 times, thanks mainly to his personal protection squad, which grew from a few fiercely loyal, hand-picked ruffians into an army with a complicated structure and intense internal competition

programme.title: Never Let Go (1960)
programme.desc: A salesman is forced to desperate measures when his car is stolen, putting his career and marriage on the line. Crime drama, starring Richard Todd and Peter Sellers

programme.title: We Are the Lambeth Boys
programme.desc: Members of the Alford House Youth Club in Kennington, London, are seen at school, work and taking part in the club's activities, in this look at youth culture in the 1950s

programme.title: In Celebration (1975)
programme.desc: In a Yorkshire mining town, three educated brothers return to their blue-collar home to celebrate the 40th Anniversary of their parents, where dark secrets come to the fore. Filmed performance of Lindsay Anderson's production of David Storey's stage play, starring Alan Bates, Brian Cox and James Bolam

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: The town's residents prepare for Lady Ludlow's garden party, but the occasion is marred by rumours the railway line will come right into Cranford, leaving Deborah feeling betrayed. Dr Harrison's plans to become better acquainted with Sophy are thwarted by Caroline Tomkinson and Clara Smith, Mr Carter takes pity on an illiterate 10-year-old and Miss Matty is shaken to see a face from her past. Starring Judi Dench, Michael Gambon and Eileen Atkins

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours narrated by Dewyne Lindsay, this time exploring Canary Wharf and Southbank

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Siobhan has Dominic promoted, but the pressure to confess to Hari mounts as he gets increasingly excited by her pregnancy. Trudi determines to win Richard back, but takes things further than she intended, while Katie desperately tries to contact Sam, and when he appears in the middle of the night, is forced to tell him the whole story of his father's death

programme.title: Prisoners of the Lost Universe (1983)
programme.desc: A scientist's teleportation device accidentally transports two mismatched modern-day people to a fantasy world, where they must prevent a barbaric warlord from obtaining advanced weaponry. Sci-fi adventure, starring Richard Hatch and Kay Lenz

programme.title: Buster (1988)
programme.desc: Fact-based crime drama about the life of Buster Edwards, a member of the gang responsible for the Great Train Robbery. Going on the run after the notorious heist, he flees to Mexico with his family. However, his homesick wife struggles to adapt to her new life, leaving the outlaw with a difficult choice. Starring Phil Collins, Julie Walters, Sheila Hancock, Larry Lamb and Ralph Brown

programme.desc: Number Six becomes a pawn in a human game of chess while trying to recruit an army of like-minded souls - and learns to judge the Villagers' allegiances by their moves. Cult drama, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: Part two of two. Professor Eunan O'Halpin investigates the struggle for Irish independence in the years after the end of the First World War, and the outbreak of civil war in 1922

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: The town's residents prepare for Lady Ludlow's garden party, but the occasion is marred by rumours the railway line will come right into Cranford, leaving Deborah feeling betrayed. programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Featuring Lee, Bermondsey and Stratford. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Phaedra (1962)
programme.desc: A Greek shipping magnate marries a younger woman, and sends her to London to bring his estranged son home. The young man begins a passionate affair with his stepmother, but is consumed with guilt for betraying his father. When she learns her husband's plans for his son, she reveals the truth, setting in motion a tragic confrontation. Drama, starring Melina Mercouri and Anthony Perkins

programme.title: The Devil's Disciple (1959)
programme.desc: The black sheep of a family is befriended by a minister. A case of mistaken identity leads both men to discover their true vocations during the American War of Independence. Historical drama based on George Bernard Shaw's play, starring Burt Lancaster, Kirk Douglas and Laurence Olivier

programme.title: The Best Man (1964)
programme.desc: Presidential candidates resort to smear tactics to have their party nominated at election time. Gore Vidal's political drama, starring Henry Fonda, Cliff Robertson, Margaret Leighton and Shelly Berman

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: World Natural Heritage: Hawaii
programme.desc: Exploring the island and its infamous mountain Manua Kea, one of the most fascinating sights of this planet

programme.title: Pet Island
programme.desc: Pampered pets and their besotted owners. Martin Bailey and his fiancee Jennifer Duggan prepare their Old English sheepdog and six Maltese for the country's biggest canine show. A group of cat lovers agree to trial a product that claims to train their pets to use the toilet

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert sets out again to explore some of Britain's finest habitats and most spectacular wildlife, beginning in Scotland's Caledonian pine forests, home to rare species including the capercaillie. Ray camps out in the hope of catching the turkey-sized grouse's courtship display, and also goes in search of the red squirrel

programme.title: Forget Me Not (2011)
programme.desc: A musician comes to the aid of a barmaid being accosted by a drunk. Together they go on a journey around London and begin to fall in love, but as the night draws to a close, a secret threatens to bring their fledgling relationship to an end before it has begun. Romantic drama, with Tobias Menzies and Genevieve O'Reilly

programme.title: Mysterious Creatures (2006)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, starring Timothy Spall and Brenda Blethyn as the parents of a woman with mental health difficulties. When their daughter's hostile behaviour and the authorities' lack of support become too much to handle, the couple decide to commit suicide together, writing a letter to a local newspaper to explain the reasons behind their actions. The cast also includes Rebekah Staton and Judy Flynn

programme.title: Relentless (2020)
programme.desc: An ex-convict must stay out of trouble for one more day to secure his freedom - but must choose between his principles and his future when he comes to the aid of a prostitute under threat from a gang. Action thriller, starring Steven Murphy and Tiffany-Ellen Robinson

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: The police wake to the news of a robbery, but the full extent of the crime and its haul - £2.6million - only becomes evident over the following days. It's clear the local CID is ill-equipped to solve a case of such magnitude, so Scotland Yard is called in, with a six-strong team of detectives headed by the Flying Squad's enigmatic chief Tommy Butler. In a race against time, they set out to identify every criminal involved and bring them to justice before they flee the country - but even if they can, will they find the money? Jim Broadbent stars in the concluding part of the drama about the most infamous heist in British history, with George Costigan, Robert Glenister, Tim Pigott-Smith, Nick Moran and John Salthouse. Written by Broadchurch creator Chris Chibnall

programme.title: Stone Age

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: Representatives from a dying planet meet members of the Moonbase Alpha crew, and offer some of them a chance to return to Earth. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: A reconstruction of Pakistan International Airlines Flight 8303, which was near the end of its 90-minute journey from Lahore to Karachi when it dramatically crashed on May 22, 2020

programme.title: Terry and Mason's Great Food Trip
programme.desc: Terry Wogan and Mason McQueen arrive in the Roman city of Bath, where they seek out the finest delicacies, from beetroot sorbet to honey glazed dormice. A reviving brew served by the UK's reigning king of the baristas sets them up for a visit to the catacombs where an eco food initiative is making mushrooms out of waste cardboard and coffee grounds

programme.title: Castle Builders

programme.title: The Big Knife (1955)
programme.desc: An unscrupulous studio executive will go to any lengths to keep a movie star on contract, even threatening to expose his part in a hit and run incident. programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions. Landing on a space reveals it's hidden contents, which could amount to a prize, or a 'hot spot', which causes contestants to forfeit their gathered winnings

programme.desc: Brentford v Fulham (Kick-off 8.00pm). Live coverage of the Premier League clash from Gtech Community Stadium. Both teams have enjoyed encouraging campaigns so far and look likely to finish in the top half of the table, but it was Fulham who claimed a 3-2 win when the London rivals met in August. Goals by Bobby Decordova-Reid and Joao Palhinha gave them a 2-0 lead, only for Chirstian Norgaard and Ivan Toney to draw Brentford level, before Aleksandar Mitrovic's late strike settled it for the Cottagers

programme.title: Live MNF
programme.desc: Brentford v Fulham (Kick-off 8.00pm). Live coverage of the Premier League clash from Gtech Community Stadium. Both teams have enjoyed encouraging campaigns so far and look likely to finish in the top half of the table, but it was Fulham who claimed a 3-2 win when the London rivals met in August. Goals by Bobby Decordova-Reid and Joao Palhinha gave them a 2-0 lead, only for Chirstian Norgaard and Ivan Toney to draw Brentford level, before Aleksandar Mitrovic's late strike settled it for the Cottagers
